intro: Trollius sajanensis, commonly known as the Sajansky buttercup, is a flowering plant native to the mountainous regions of Central Asia. It belongs to the genus Trollius in the family Ranunculaceae, which includes various species of buttercups. The plant is characterized by its showy, yellow, saucer-shaped flowers that bloom in late summer. It typically grows in rocky or alpine habitats, thriving in well-drained soils. Due to its limited distribution and habitat specificity, it is considered a rare and endangered species.
